availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Jeffersonville, Indiana, washerwoman. Kentucky native. Married to George Toliver in 1849. Washerwoman in Jeffersonville in 1860. Arrested and sentenced to prison in Frankfort, Kentucky, in 1864 for her work helping fugitive enslaved persons gain their freedom.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Indiana, Clark County, Jeffersonville, p. 47.
"Black History Month," The Courier Journal (Louisville, Ky.), February 24, 2009, p. B2.
